front.title: Pseudo-flavors for Remote Procedure Calls with Transport Layer Security

abstract.t: Recent innovations in Remote Procedure Call (RPC) transport layer security enable broad deployment of encryption and mutual peer authentication when exchanging RPC messages. These security mechanisms can protect peers who continue to use the AUTH_SYS RPC auth flavor, which is not cryptographically secure, on open networks. This document introduces several RPC auth pseudo-flavors and other mechanisms that an RPC service can use to indicate transport layer security requirements for accessing that service.
